content: the shandon blanket by marion mitchell 2018 woolthreadpaint on instagram and facebook this is a free step by step guide for my blanket it is intended as an informal recounting of how the blanket was made the yarn and colours used and has not been pattern tested you can use the guide to produce a blanket for your own use as a gift or to sell but please do not sell copies of the pattern either digitally or in hard copy you are kindly asked not to reprint any part of the pattern on websites social media or blogs without first seeking permission from myself if you have any questions about the pattern you can contact me through instagram facebook or leave a message on my blog have fun measurements are 100cms x 100cms 39ins x 39ins and is suitable as a sofa throw or lap blanket you will need stylecraft batik dk 2 x 50g balls in silver graphite biscuit and olive 1 x 50g ball in rose old gold coral cherry raspberry plum sage lupin heather violet pistachio teal storm and mint a 4mm crochet hook large blunt tapestry or yarn needle scissors abbreviations chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet us treble_crochet treble_crochet double in us dtr double treble_crochet treble in us special stitch treble_crochet cluster stitch - treble_crochet cluster in us 1 with loop on hook yarn over twice 3 loops insert hook into base stitch and pull up a loop 4 loops on hook yarn over and pull through two loops yarn over and pull through two loops 2 loops left on hook 2 repeat the beginning of the treble_crochet stitch into the same stitch leaving the last loop of each stitch on the hook as many times as needed 3 3 yarn over hook and pull through all the remaining loops on the hook to draw all the stitches together to make a cluster finish with a chain stitch the following grid shows the placement of colours for the 36 granny squares in the middle of the blanket each box is numbered 1 -
